intro: Cephalomappa penangensis, commonly known as the Penang starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and culinary uses, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
